title: Right of company to pledge its own shares.
content: 57E. The pledge by the company of its own shares, either by itself or by a person acting in his name, but on its behalf, shall be considered acquisition of shares in the manner mentioned in sections 57A, in paragraph (1) of section 57B and in sections 57D and 53 of this Law: Provided that the provisions of this section shall not apply to cases of pledging of a number of shares within the context of current transactions carried out by a company with banks and other credit institutions. Subscription, acquisition or holding of shares through subsidiary. 15 of 70(I) of 2003.
